Get the base API response for a data set's meta data

get_meta_response.Rd

Get the metadata information for a data set available from the EES API.

Usage

get_meta_response(
  dataset_id,
  dataset_version = NULL,
  api_version = NULL,
  parse = TRUE
)

Arguments

dataset_id

ID of data set to be connected to

dataset_version

Version of data set to be connected to

api_version

EES API version

parse

Parse result into structured list

Value

Results of query to API meta data endpoint

Examples

get_meta_response(example_id())
#> $filters
#>      id      column       label                  hint
#> 1 5mvdi school_type School type Filter by school type
#>                                                                                                      options
#> 1 LfnWj, 6TUrf, 0wOT5, HsQzL, Special, State-funded primary, State-funded secondary, Total, NA, NA, NA, TRUE
#> 
#> $indicators
#>      id              column
#> 1 tImEm     fixed_excl_rate
#> 2 fS3YF          fixed_excl
#> 3 jXkAM           perm_excl
#> 4 ehquS           headcount
#> 5 TREPJ      one_plus_fixed
#> 6 h8fyW         num_schools
#> 7 mLC9K one_plus_fixed_rate
#> 8 gHcO9      perm_excl_rate
#>                                                           label
#> 1                                   Fixed period exclusion rate
#> 2                             Number of fixed period exclusions
#> 3                                Number of permanent exclusions
#> 4                                              Number of pupils
#> 5     Number of pupils with one or more fixed period exclusions
#> 6                                             Number of schools
#> 7 Percentage of pupils with one or more fixed period exclusions
#> 8                                      Permanent exclusion rate
#> 
#> $geographicLevels
#>   code           label
#> 1   LA Local authority
#> 2  NAT        National
#> 3  REG        Regional
#> 4  SCH          School
#> 
#> $locations
#>   level.code     level.label
#> 1         LA Local authority
#> 2        NAT        National
#> 3        REG        Regional
